related_questions.question: What is the difference between an organized and unorganized sector?
related_questions.snippet: What is the key difference between an organized and unorganized sector? The organized sector is registered with the government, whereas the unorganized sector is not registered with the government and does not follow the labour laws implemented.
related_questions.title: Organized vs Unorganized Sector - Definition & Key Difference

related_questions.question: What is the unorganized sector class 10?
related_questions.snippet: The unorganised sector is one in which labor arrangements are not set and consistent, and businesses are not regulated by the government. Personnel in the organised sector are paid monthly. Workers in the unorganised sector, however, get paid on a regular or even daily basis.

answer_box.title: How to Protect Workers in the Unorganized Sector
answer_box.snippet: Unorganized sector workers face many challenges, including exploitation. The government and other groups must work together to protect these workers.
